translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Vibhītaka
“The One Well-Gone, with a golden complexion,
like a blossoming Sāl tree king.
Having prepared a grass mat,🔽I asked the best Buddha,
‘May the Buddha have compassion on me,
I wish to give a gift of alms.’🔽The compassionate one, the sympathetic one,
the one who sees the benefit, the one of great fame,
I gave it to the best Buddha.
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving the fruit.
Welcome indeed it was for me,🔽…
The Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.
The Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.”🔽Thus the elder Bhallāṭiya recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā bhallātadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Bhallātadāyakattherassāpadānaṁ catutthaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā bhallātadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽bhallātadāyaka therassa apadānam catuttha
translated: The Story of Elder Bhallāṭiya is finished.
